summary: Since the Department of Homeland Security began in 2003, it has looked for ways to integrate and coordinate air and marine operations of its component agencies, primarily the Coast Guard and Customs and Border Protection. These organizations share responsibility for patrolling and securing U.S. borders. Homeland Security's ongoing efforts to examine the benefits and costs of consolidating CBP and Coast Guard air and marine operating...
title: Department of Homeland Security: Assessment of Air and Marine Operating Locations Should Include Comparable Costs across All DHS Marine Operations
